alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Essex; Lamoille; Orleans; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 9:44PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lamoille, central Caledonia, south central Orleans, southwestern Essex and northeastern Washington Counties through 1045 PM EDT... At 944 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Worcester, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... St. Johnsbury, Lyndon, Greensboro, Lyndonville Village, Stannard, Woodbury, Wheelock, Glover, Hardwick, Kirby, Albany, Wolcott, Greensboro Bend, Danville, Walden, Sheffield, Craftsbury, Elmore, Barton Village, and Irasburg. This includes Interstate 91 between mile markers 132 and 156. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
